text: [Music]
this is Norway's new and controversial
border fence with Russia it's being
built next to the store Skog border
point the northernmost road crossing
into Europe's Schengen passport-free
zone last year around 5,500 asylum
seekers many from Syria cross from
Russia into Norway here taking the so
called Arctic route into Europe the flow
of refugees has since come to a halt but
officials say the 200 metre long fence
will help to secure the checkpoint in
the event of any future mass migration
so I'm on the Norwegian side of the
fence here and just over there around
100 metres away is the Russian border
I'm not allowed to film in that
direction because of security
restrictions but here's the new fence
it's four meters tall and around three
millimetres thick and it costs around
five hundred thousand US dollars in the
nearby town of Schick and s the new
fence has had a lukewarm reception since
the fall of the Iron Curtain authorities
here have worked to improve ties with
Russia including visa-free travel for
residents on both sides of the border
leaders of the local municipality say
the fence is a backward step it's really
embarrassing for us local so near Russia
we want to build bridges to Russia not
build fences
but what do Russians make of the sense

it's not just the Syrian refugees who

we have a very good working dialogue

which means that this is nothing

the fence is due for completion by the

as setback for construction border
